title: Decay - possible nuclei from U-235 decay

content.question: A nucleus of uranium-235 <math alttext="open parenthesis, U with mass number 235 and atomic number 92, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>(</mo><mmultiscripts><mtext>U</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>92</mn><mn>235</mn></mmultiscripts><mo>)</mo></math> splits into two other nuclei, <math alttext="X with mass number question mark and atomic number question mark" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mo>?</mo><mo>?</mo></mmultiscripts></math> and <math alttext="Z with mass number question mark and atomic number question mark" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Z</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mo>?</mo><mo>?</mo></mmultiscripts></math>. Which of the following are possible representations of <math alttext="X with mass number question mark and atomic number question mark" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mo>?</mo><mo>?</mo></mmultiscripts></math> and <math alttext="Z with mass number question mark and atomic number question mark" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Z</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mo>?</mo><mo>?</mo></mmultiscripts></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="X with mass number 1 and atomic number 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>1</mn><mn>1</mn></mmultiscripts></math> and <math alttext="Z with mass number 236 and atomic number 91" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Z</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>91</mn><mn>236</mn></mmultiscripts></math>

<math alttext="X with mass number 2 and atomic number 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mmultiscripts></math> and <math alttext="Z with mass number 233 and atomic number 93" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Z</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>93</mn><mn>233</mn></mmultiscripts></math>

<math alttext="X with mass number 0 and atomic number 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>2</mn><mn>0</mn></mmultiscripts></math> and <math alttext="Z with mass number 235 and atomic number 90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Z</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>90</mn><mn>235</mn></mmultiscripts></math>

<math alttext="X with mass number 4 and atomic number 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></mmultiscripts></math> and <math alttext="Z with mass number 231 and atomic number 90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Z</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>90</mn><mn>231</mn></mmultiscripts></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="X with mass number 4 and atomic number 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>X</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></mmultiscripts></math> and <math alttext="Z with mass number 231 and atomic number 90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mmultiscripts><mtext>Z</mtext><mprescripts></mprescripts><mn>90</mn><mn>231</mn></mmultiscripts></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
